intro: Tripterium pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered tripterium, is a small evergreen shrub native to the temperate regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and other ericaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with dense clusters of small, leathery leaves. It produces tiny, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. The species is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in rocky or wooded areas.
